answerText: Alexander Sergeyevich Pushkin[10] This author of A Georgian Night and The Young Spouses is doubtless best‐known for his satirical look at the aristocracy, Woe From Wit. He also died in 1829 during a mob attack on the Russian embassy in Tehran, after which his head was cut off by a kebab vendor.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Editors 3 | 2 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Name these author of the Russian Golden Age, for 10 points each. [10] This national poet created the gambling‐addicted Hermann in The Queen of Spades and the pursuer of Tanya and Olga in Eugene Onegin.
